intro: Strobilanthes fauriei, commonly known as the golden flame or flame flower, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling flames. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Strobilanthes fauriei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated for its unique floral display.
